characters: THE SHAPE APPEARS IN FRONT OF THE WALL.
THE SHAPE GRABS HER BY THE NECK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Langley, Illinois.  A quiet suburb located fifty miles outside of Chicago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER the legend:  "Langley, Illinois.  October 28th 1998

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: nestled in the middle of a tree-lined street.  A Honda Ci pulls into a darkened driveway, the headlights are extinguished...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAMELA WHITTINGTON, a middle-aged woman in full registere nurse attire, emerges from the parked car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An unlit cigarette dangles loosely from her lips.  She he to the porch, digging through her purse in search of a light...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pamela stops in her tracks, looks down at her feet to dis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: scattered across the porch.  She looks at the porch light hanging above her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHATTERED LIGHT BULB occupies the socket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pamela turns her attention to the front door... it's slig ajar.  She pushes on it gently.... the door swings open freely, revealing the darkened interior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pamela drops her purse... darts across some hedges into t neighbor's yard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pamela runs up to the porch, decorated with carved pumpkins... POUNDS furiously on the front door, decorated with a CARDBOARD SKELETON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She POUNDS again... HARDER.  Suddenly, the door SWINGS op to reveal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: looming in the doorway.  A HOCKEY MASK cloaks his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: glare at Pamela from behind the cut-outs in the plastic vizard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gasps, stumbles backward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: flips up his mask to reveal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a gangly teen, wearing a hockey jersey... skates slung ov his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mis Whittington, what's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My blood pleasure.  You scared the hell out of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Sorry.  I'm on my way to the ring and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) I think someone broke into my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pamela sits on the couch taking hits off a lit cigarette. Jimmy paces the room, portable phone pressed against his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) 3037 Keystone.. yeah... gotcha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy hangs up the portable...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Said to give 'em fifteen minutes. They'll send someone by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy grabs his hockey stick, heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Checking out your place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Wait for the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And miss the big game?  No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pamela stands at the foot of her driveway... watches as J climbs the steps to her porch, hockey stick perched high his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: moves toward the front door, stepping on pieces of shatte light bulb beneath him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swings open the front door with the tip of his stick.. looks inside the darkened house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He enters cautiously, stick at the ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: lights up another cigarette, watches nervously as Jimmy disappears from view...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy enters the dimmed foyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling off) Hey, man, don't mess with me! I'll knock your head clean off your body!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves stealthily through the house, hockey stick poise high in the air... room-by-room he checks for intruders.. Jimmy finds his way to the rear of the home, crosses to a back bedroom, stands in the doorway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Oh, shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Converted to a home office... ransacked... file cabinets overturned, pictures hang crooked on the walls, papers ca the floor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: drops the stick to his side, convinced he is now alone in house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crosses back into the kitchen... steals a cookie from cookie jar... opens the fridge... takes a swig from an op milk carton... completely unaware that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is opening slowly behind him, then suddenly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An IRONING BOARD topples out from inside, slams against h back, hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: snaps the hockey stick into position... spins around... swings wildly with the wooden baton.  He makes contact wi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: suspended above the island... pots dangling from their ho come clanging down on top of him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dust settles... Jimmy realizes he's been beating the stuffing out of an ironing board.  He sheepishly exits th kitchen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pamela stands at the foot of the driveway, trying to see to the darkened house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, damn it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy emerges from the house... looks like Wayne Gretsky after slamming in his record goal.  He smiles at Pamela smugly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing to fear.  The coast is clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Totally.  I checked all the rooms and closets...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's missing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't think so.  But they sure did a real number on your office. Crap everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My office?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Oh, and they messed up your kitchen pretty good, too... Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy scurries off, avoiding any more questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pamela heads back to the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pamela enters the house, LOCKS AND BOLTS the front door behind her.  She breathes a heavy sigh of relief, back against the door... she flicks on a light switch... NOTHI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, Jimmy... didn't you try the goddamn lights?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pamela moves down the hallway to the laundry room... she opens the door to the FUSE BOX... toggles some fuses on a off... tries the laundry room light... still NOTHING, darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs a flashlight out of the nearby cupboard, and proceeds down the hall to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The converted bedroom in complete disarray... Pamela navigates through the wreckage, carving a path with the b of her flashlight.  She approaches --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: completely bare except for a single FILE FOLDER resting o its top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: shines the beam on the lone file folder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON the folder... the index tab reads "KERI TATE."  Pamela opens the folder, it's EMPTY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gasps, the blood rushes from her face.  She immediately rushes for the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A noise is heard.  She's not alone in this house.  She mo through the hallway to discover the front door wide open. Shit.  She bolts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pamela runs out the door and back to Jimmy's house.  She opens the front door, disappears inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pamela shuts the door behind her... cranes her neck, searching for any signs of Jimmy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She HEARS the sounds of a television emanating from deep within the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling off) Jimmy!  You still there?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA FOLLOWS Pamela as she makes her way from one darke room to the next... she crosses into the den to discover

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: seated in an easy-chair, watching an episode of "SEINFELD his back to Pamela... only his legs are visible from her point-of-view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pamela approaches him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit, Jimmy!  Someone's still in my house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pamela spins the easy-chair around to reveal --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: embedded deep into Jimmy's face... the blade slicing thro flesh, from forehead to chin... eyes wide open in terror. blood cascades down his jersey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: screams... bolts through the house, reaches the front doo find --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pushed in front of it, blocks her way!  She tries fiercel move the wooden hutch, but can't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pamela runs back through the house, frantic... in despera search of an exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She crosses into the kitchen, spots her escape... moves t the rear door, opens it to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: standing, poised, evil eyes burning through slits in his trademark mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: shrieks... grabs a knife out of a nearby butcher block... heads back to the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: moves after her, the hunt is on...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHING RED AND BLUE LIGHTS
dialogues.text: illuminate the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: runs to a window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A squad car arrives in front of Pamela's house.  Two UNIFORMED COPS emerge from the vehicle, head up her drive

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Struggles to open the window... she can't manage to disen the lock... she pounds feverishly on the glass --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) HELP!  GODDAMNIT IT!  OVER HERE! GOD PLEASE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: appears behind her... grabs an IRON POKER from a group of fireplace utensils.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: spins around, swings at the Shape with the knife...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay the fuck away from me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shape swings the iron poker... delivers a severe blow Pamela's arm... breaks it... the knife falls to the floor below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pamela howls in pain... drops to her knees, nurses her ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shape raises the poker high into the air, comes down hard... drives the tip of the poker through her skull...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the f.g. two cops climb the porch steps and move into house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the b.g. we can see the Shape through the neighboring window as he repeatedly stabs Pamela with the poker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL a co-ed boarding school.. set behind massive wrought-iron gates on acreage in a secluded region of Wisconsin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER the legend:  "Ferndale, Wisconsin.  October 29th 19

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The academy's gothic architecture and rich history can be seen throughout the entire campus, consisting of a cluste buildings:  the school, the dorms, a gymnasium with indoo swimming pool, a bell tower, a guard house and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: litters the far end of the campus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a kitchen window.  Inside KERI TATE, mid-thirtie stands behind a sink washing dishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On closer inspection, we see that this face is none other that LAURIE STRODE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri stands with her back to JOHN, 16, chiseled good look He stands behind her in the doorway... They are in mid- conversation --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's changed since yesterday, or last week, or last month... the answer's still "no."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so predictable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri grabs the sprayer, squirts John from across the room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) What the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betcha' didn't predict that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri throws John a dishtowel... he dabs at his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sixteen, Keri.  I should be able to live wherever I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I should have a son who calls me "Mom".  Looks like we're both shit out of luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you win.  I'll call you Mom. Now can I move into the dorms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri hands John a stack of clean dishes.  John doesn't budge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Dad thinks it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're father thinks it's okay to run off to Cancun with a blonde bimbo in a halter top.  Somehow his opinion doesn't count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise not to run off to Cancun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing out the kitchen window) The dorms are only fifty feet away.  You could practically see into my window.  So, what difference does it make?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My point exactly.  See, we both agree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri takes the dishes back from John, puts them away in a overhead cupboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, I was wrong.  There is a big difference between rooming with your buddies and living with your mother and school headmaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took the padlock off your door. What more do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My life is a living hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri raises an eyebrow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not, trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John gives up, heads out of the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the bathroom.  Can I do that alone or do you want to watch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you'd never ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri puts her arms around John, escorts him out of the kitchen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're twisted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri moves across campus toward the school, a leather briefcase slung over one shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passing STUDENTS ad-lib "Hellos," their admiration for Ke made evident by their favorable rapport with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri passes in front of --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: parked alongside the school.  An older bus on the far end sits empty, hood up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALLY BECKETTE, a rather portly man in his early sixties, the school custodian, fiddles with the exposed engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally, you've been under that hood for months.  Why don't we just call a mechanic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally stops what he is doing... comes out from beneath th hood... wipes his hands on his pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Tate, I serviced B-1 Bombers in W-W-2.  This here is child's play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're saying I should call a child to come give you a hand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally chuckles softly, charmed by Keri like the rest of t staff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saying she'll be purring like a kitten before you know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's your problem, Walter.  You don't want it to purr, you want it to start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she will, Miss Tate.  She will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri continues toward the school.  Wally watches with admiration as she heads into the building...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Mmmm-mmm.  If they had teachers like you when I was a boy, I'd be a rocket scientist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally goes back to tinkering with the engine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON HATTIE SMITH, mid-sixties, dressed in a guard uniform. approaches Keri, looking very official... holds a key in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Hattie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Went into town.  Had that duplicate key made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hattie hands Keri the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hattie extends an open hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank me with two bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri digs through her pocket, produces a handful of chang gives it to Hattie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dripping sarcasm) Just what I wanted... more change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hattie heads back toward the guard house, turns back to Keri --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) And next time you lose a gate key, young lady, you'll be climbing your way out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri holds the key to her chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be more careful next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hattie dismisses Keri with a wave of her hand, continues across campus to the guard house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri smiles, places the key in her pocket and disappears inside the school...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pouring rain.  In stark contrast to the sunny campus of Hillcrest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMERGENCY VEHICLES litter the landscape, lights FLASHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICERS wrap yellow crime scene tape around the perimete keeping curious NEIGHBORS at bay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a middle-aged police detective, eyes bloodshot from too little sleep and one too many hours in front of a compute screen, emerges from a dark Sedan... a lit cigarette dang loosely from his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter approaches a young OFFICER standing outside the fr door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flashes his badge) Detective Richard Carter, Haddonfield P.D.  Detective Blake called my office...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officer motions to the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on in.  She's been waiting for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter heads towards the door, the Officer grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You might need this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officer offers him a small jar of petroleum jelly. Carter waves it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Some serious shit in there, Detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter reconsiders, smears the Vaseline under each nostri heads for the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter crosses through the front door, watches as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TEAM of latex-gloved FORENSIC SPECIALISTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: dust door and windows for fingerprints, swab at blood dro and collect carpet fibers for later analysis...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter crosses into the living room, winces at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sprawled across the floor in front of blood-soaked curtains... the wrought-iron poker jammed up her nose, ex through the top of her skull... a kitchen knife lies besi her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter takes another hit off the cigarette, blows smoke i the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Double homicide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter turns to see

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: standing behind him... mid-twenties, attractive yet approachable...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her name's Pamela Whittington, next door neighbor to victim number two... James Howell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter motions in the direction of the den where

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: takes snapshots of the teenage corpse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me guess... he's the guy with the hockey skate for a nose ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: crosses to Carter, extends a dixie cup in his direction -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks, I'm not thirsty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for your cigarette.  I prefer not to contaminate my crime scene with micropollutants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter takes a final puff off the cigarette, drops it int the cup...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why am I here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said on the phone you were assigned to the Meyers case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all due respect, detective, you can't go blaming every brutal murder in Illinois on Michael Meyers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pamela Whittington was a long time associate of Dr. Loomis.  Her home office was ransacked.  It was chock full of Loomis' files on Meyers.  It'd say that makes Meyers a suspect, wouldn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, when you put it that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  So why don't we get on with this investigation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like a woman who takes control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blake ignores the comment, crosses to the front door... Carter follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During the following dialogue, Blake walks Carter through crime scene reenacting the prior evening's brutal events.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pamela entered the house and walked into the den where she discovers James Howell's body...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter and Blake stand in front of the mutilated face of teenage boy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Shaken, she returns to the front door to find the hutch blocking her exit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON gouges across the wood planks, forming tracks from the dining room to the front door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) She runs to the kitchen, where she is ambushed at the back door by the killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter and Blake stand in front of the door, which is sti open.  Carter kneels down, looks at the kitchen floor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One set of muddy shoe prints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That don't match either of the victim's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter stands up, moves to a butcher block on the counter he's starting to enjoy this dance --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs a knife from the butcher block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON the butcher block, an empty slot where the knife once resided...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heads to the living room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They cross back into the living room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter moves to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: covered in fingerprint powder, exposing a plethora of pri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where, judging by the looks of the finger and palm prints, she struggles to open the window before banging on it like hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unable to escape, she turns and attacks the killer, but doesn't connect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No blood on the knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON the knife, clean as a whistle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) The killer knocks the knife out of her hand with the wrought-iron poker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broken blood vessels on her right forearm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON Pamela's arm, a bruise forming under the skin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As which point she drops to her knees in pain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Explaining the low height of the blood splatter on the curtains...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON the curtains, blood stained four feet and below...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impressive, Blake.  Where'd you learn how to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girl scouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter chuckles... she has a sense of humor, too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hallway is flooded with STUDENTS, books in tow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a young seventeen, friendly eyes and a face to match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking beside her is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LINDA KANG, same age, unconcerned, full of spunk... multi body piercings, doesn't quite fit in here or anywhere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You aced it, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda grabs Molly's test, peeking out from her biology bo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gave me a fuckin' A?  Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda punches Molly playfully in the arm.  They stop at neighboring lockers, retrieve books from inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMY KRAMER approaches, book pressed against an ample ches smacking on a wad of gum...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eye-catching good looks, a real stunner... a bit short on gray matter though --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These lockers are totally girl unfriendly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Break another nail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pointer finger.  And the dance is in two days...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life's a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls head down the hall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie's working late at Freeman's tonight... all alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought Eddie left for N.Y.U.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess he couldn't tear himself away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess he couldn't pass admissions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, pinhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John approaches them from behind, drapes his arms around Molly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are. (to Amy) You tell 'em about tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just got here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John removes a key from his jacket pocket, drops it in Molly's hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say, "The key to my heart," and I'm gonna hurl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelve the barf bag.  It's the key to the main gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swiped it from my mom's desk yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stole it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I borrowed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Party at Freeman's tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am in need of some serious partying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't afford to get caught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly, you're the resident assistant.  What are you gonna do, narc on yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Students clear the hall, move inside their classrooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John kisses Molly on the lips...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just meet me in front of the gate after lights out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes off down the hall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after him) Wait... John...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone.  A teacher guides the girls inside a classroom shuts the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bevy of STUDENTS scurry about the gym making final preparations for the impending Halloween Festivals:  hang decorations on walls, carving pumpkins, spinning cob webs along refreshment tables...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON WILL BRENNEN, a well-favored Chemistry teacher in his forties, thinning hair, more salt than pepper... supervis the action... a coffee mug in hand... his attention focus on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sitting atop the bleachers.  Will climbs the benches, sit beside her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a sight for sore eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her softly on the lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) ... and ears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) ...and lips...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He engages her in a lingering kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: point and giggle at the smooching faculty members.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri notices, pulls away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She motions toward the students below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  They've all taken sex ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans in for another kiss, she playfully keeps him at length...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this isn't the place for a live demonstration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will relents, settles for holding Keri's hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't they doing a terrific job this year?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distracted) Looks great.  It does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?  You seem a little off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing a good stiff drink can't fix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will doesn't find the humor, eyes her uneasily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) That one always goes over big at the AA meetings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's John, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's always John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still wants to move out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been living out of moving boxes for three months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This kid just wants his freedom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not going to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tighter you squeeze, the harder he'll try to break free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please... you get that out of a fortune cookie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't make it bad advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri manages a smile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) God I love that smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri stands.  Will follows suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going into town... run a few errands before dark.  Need anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A box of fortune cookies... I'm running out of advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri heads down the bleachers.  Will watches her leave, completely enamored...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A family-owned grocery mart in the heart of Ferndale.  A dozen CUSTOMERS mingle through the aisles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON Keri, standing in front of a CASHIER as he rings up a dozen items...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri glances at the wall of tabloids in front of her, one them catches her eye --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A headline reads: "SERIAL KILLER MICHAEL MEYERS REALLY AL FROM OUTER SPACE."  Beneath the headline is a mock photo the Shape, holding the infamous mask in his hand, reveali an alien head underneath....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri can't help but smirk at the absurdity of it all.  Th cashier hands Keri her change...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy Halloween.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri manages a polite smile, and exits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri moves down the tree-lined street, groceries tucked securely under her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pauses at a storefront window.  "KESSLER JEWELERS.  E 1963" emblazoned across the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An assortment of wedding rings glimmer behind the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: holds her left hand up to the window, moving it slowly fr ring to ring... then she sees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in the reflection... standing across the street, staring right through her... taunting her.  This is no alien...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: heart stops... she stands frozen, totally immobile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: passes between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: takes this opportunity to spin around.  The truck passes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate this fucking holiday...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri climbs into the driver's seat of her Ford Explorer, tosses the bag of groceries on the passenger seat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts the engine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "MR. SANDMAN" blares over the radio... scares the shit ou her.  Keri quickly changes stations... heads back to the school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparsely decorated.  Scattered Chinese food containers li the counters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a glass dining room table, a table dozen cardboard box "DR. LOOMIS" in black sharpie scrawled across their sides

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA PANS across the table where...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sits, eyes glazed over... shuffling through a stack of photographs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of a young Michael Meyers playing with a fire truck in th den... running through sprinklers in the backyard... ridi horses at the county fair... no signs of the evil lurking inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARTER sets the photographs aside, digs through a file bo pulls out a film canister marked "MEYERS' HOME MOVIES."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARTER threads the Super 8 film through it, turns it on.. images of a young Michael Meyers are projected on a bare in the darkened room. CARTER settles into the recliner, fights to stay awake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The home movies projected on his pale mask.  He moves slo toward the sleeping CARTER, a knife in his grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHAPE raises the knife to CARTER's throat, slices it ear to ear.  CARTER grabs his throat, blood gushes throug his fingers.  Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gasps for air... he feels for his throat... no blood, all well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Super 8 films slaps against the projector, the reel n over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARTER catches his breath... surveys the room... he is al He picks up the phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Carter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Blake.  Meet me at Grand View.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cemetery...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, alright... I'll be there in ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter hangs up the phone, massages his throat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL a mannequin sporting the mask dark overalls made notorious by Michael Meyers... its arm posed high in the air, wielding a meat cleaver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gathered around the mannequin is the gang: Linda is in the arms of her boyfriend, SHANE McCLOUD... a tall and spindly teen, book smart and street dumb...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John riffles through a rack of Halloween costumes.  Molly leans against a nearby counter... she checks her watch, visibly uncomfortable being here at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDDIE CATERO, two years out of high school and still wear his letterman jacket, 'Nuff said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands proudly by his display, nursing a beer... his a draped around Amy, who's painting her nails with a nail polish plucked from a nearby display...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the display) Pretty wicked, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's twisted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This coming from the girl with a stake through her tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're glorifying the big creep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, it's historically inaccurate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael Meyers never used a meat cleaver.  It was a butcher knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you, the serial killer police?  What difference does it make?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not historically accurate, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He could be holding a swizzle stick, it still gives me the willies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry... I hear he only kills virgins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another historical inaccuracy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would somebody shut this guy up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, we better get back before Mrs. Sullivan makes her rounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda looks at her watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit.  Molly's right.  It's eleven-thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang heads for the front door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys go on.  Eddie's gonna take me back after he closes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bells hanging from the door JINGLE as they exit...  John turns to them as he leaves --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Condoms are on aisle four...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie pushes John out the door, shuts it behind him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group moves down the deserted street, headed for Hillcrest.  John's arm around Molly.  Shane's around Lind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being hung on the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL Amy, holds up her newly polis nails to Eddie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you like the color?  It's called "Bloodshed Red."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah... looks good...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie grabs Amy by the waist, pulls her in... kisses her passionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Let's go in back and check out the "inventory."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmmm, sounds good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie and Amy head to the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie and Amy get hot and heavy amongst a room full of cardboard boxes, Halloween costumes, and mask...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Eddie prepares to do the one-hand bra release...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bells hung on the front door chime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.  Can't people read?  Don't move.  I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie exits, leaving behind a half-naked Amy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie moves toward the front of the store, heads down the center aisle.  He hears the SHUFFLING OF FEET in the aisl next to him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling off) Hey, we're closed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie rounds the corner, runs smack into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only the mannequin, which isn't where Eddie left it. arm poised high in the air, knife missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie turns around to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: standing right behind him, wielding the meat cleaver. Eddie's seeing double...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shape attacks, slices through his skull with the meat cleaver...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Amy sifts through a box of scary masks, she hears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: outside the door... she throws on her blouse, peeks outsi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Damnit, Eddie!  Stop fooling around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still nothing... Amy cautiously moves into the store, loo for her missing partner... she passes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you think you're gettin' any after this, you're dead wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stumbles, looks down to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sprawled on the floor, the meat cleaver buried in the mid of his forehead... eyes wide open in terror!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy SCREAMS... can barely stand... she stumbles to the fr of the door... it's locked! The Michael Meyers mannequin behind her comes to life, be to move toward her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy beats frantically on the glass door, struggling to fr the lock... she turns to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: closing in behind her... she SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHAPE attacks, grabs Amy by the back of the neck... pushes her face through the glass door, cuts it to bits..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lifts Amy high into the air, she struggles to free herself... the Shape impales her body on a large shard of glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON Amy's feet... dangling a foot off the ground... then..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her body goes completely limp... lifeless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON Amy's hand... blood cascades down her fingers, matches shade of her nail polish...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHAPE looks at her breathless body quizzically...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A well manicured graveyard... lush green lawns, thriving trees, and patches of blooming flowers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRED WILLIAMS, an elderly caretaker, leads Carter and Bla through the darkened cemetery... a flashlight illuminatin their path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take all your dates here. Blake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only the real stiffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can be real stiff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Watch my geraniums.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter looks down at his feet, finds himself standing in middle of a group of flowers... he quickly hops back onto grass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Beautiful, aren't they?  Rotting corpses make the best fertilizer, ya' know.  Especially those Irish folk.  They push up the daises like a son-of-a-bitch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll remember that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, I can tell you where every Mick is buried by the ground cover growing above 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred shines his flashlight on a distant grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Irish... (shining the beam on another grave) ...Irish...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop in front of a gravesite... TOMBSTONE missing... patchy grass covers the grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Never could get anything to grow cover this one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're sure this is Laurie Strode's grave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure as I'm standing here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred shines the beam of the flashlight on an adjacent headstone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Buried her daughter right next to her not too long ago.  You don't suppose that Meyers fella took the tombstone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably just a couple of kids playing a Halloween prank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tee-peeing a house, yes.  A bag of burning shit on a porch, maybe. Digging up tombstone?  I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter shrugs his shoulders, take a drag off his cigarett

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter heads back to his car.  Blake runs after him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Care to join me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Carter.  You know it's Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do, put out an A.P.B. on a man in overalls wearing a white mask dragging a headstone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet dreams, Blake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter climbs into his car, heads for home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri tosses and turns in her bed, unable to exorcise the demons from her mind... eyes wide open, watches the moonl cast the shadows of dancing leaves on the ceiling above h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, the shadow of something altogether unnatural appear above her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hair tattered and tousled by the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON Keri lying frozen in fear, eyes unblinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: grows larger, nearly engulfs the entire ceiling... then suddenly disappears from view... the dancing leaves retur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A noise from outside her window.  FOOTSTEPS quickly make their way around the house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri jumps out of her skin, holds her breath...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A JIGGLING SOUND emanates from the living room, as if someone's trying to get in through the front door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri jumps out of her bed, slides a metal box out from un the bed... pulls a SMITH AND WESSON from inside... heads for --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri moves silently through the hallway into the living r gun at the ready... hands trembling... eyes locked on the front door as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: slowly twists and turns... the SHADOW of a man behind the curtain of the window flanking the side of the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: raises the gun... uses both hands to steady her aim... he breathing becoming more shallow with each passing second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: swings open revealing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: house key in hand... busted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: lowers the gun, fights back in tears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John closes the door... if he's surprised that his mother pointing a gun in his face, he doesn't show it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, John!  What the hell were you doing out there?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding with that answer, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just went for a walk.  It's no big deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong.  There are rules in this house and you're going to follow them whether you like it or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or what?  You're gonna shoot me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an option.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe if you'd let me live in the dorms, I wouldn't have to sneak out to spend time with my friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, so now it's my fault?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just forget it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John storms down the hall, disappears into his bedroom... slams the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri enters the room, passes by the window... glances out into the night and sees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: standing between sheets that blow in the clothesline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: closes her eyes, takes a deep breath... opens them... now both the Shape and the sheets blowing in the clothesline VANISHED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri substituting for the absentee English Lit teacher. Elliot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STUDENT has just finished her oral report and heads bac her seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri stands, crosses to the chalkboard --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure Mr. Elliot will go over this when he returns on Monday, but Julie hit on a very important aspect of Virgil's "The Aeniad."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She scrawls the word "FATE" across its surface...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) F-A-T-E.  Fate.  The Romans believed in the three goddesses of Fate, called "the Fate."  Nona, Decuma, and Morta.  These goddesses determined your fate. They were to blame when things went wrong, and were to be praised when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri passes in front of the classroom, glances out the wi and sees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: standing behind the gates of the academy, waiting patient for his chance... eyes burning a hold right through her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: wait for Keri to complete her thought... mumble softly amongst themselves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: closes her eyes for a moment, takes a deep breath... look outside again... the Shape is STILL THERE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The students make a mad dash for the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: moves swiftly through the throng of students, pushing bewildered pupils aside as she makes her way to the schoo entrance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri emerges from the building, moves across the campus toward the iron gates... runs smack into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: throws his arms around her waist...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa... what's the hurry?  I'm not going anywhere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri doesn't respond, is too busy looking over Will's shoulder --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KERI'S POV of the gate... the SHAPE has once again disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri eyes the perimeter of the campus, searching for her lost brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Hey, you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distracted) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.  I just need to lie down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri breaks free from Will's grip, heads toward the facul housing, determined.  Will watches her leave, face laced concern...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri climbs atop a foot stool, retrieves a BOTTLE of Vodk concealed behind bags of flour on the top shelf of the pantry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She spins off the top... brings the lip of the bottle to mouth, hands trembling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops short of taking the drink, bring the bottle dow from her lips...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri climbs off the foot stool, crosses to the kitchen si and pours the Vodka down the drain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blake sits behind her desk leafing through the double homicide case file, looking for some stone that's been le unturned...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She removes a FILE FOLDER from an evidence bag, "KERI TAT in type across the index tape...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blake opens it... still empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light from her desk lamp falls across the open folder reveals a series of indentations in the left hand corner the manilla paper...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: struggles to make out the ghost writing... grabs a pencil moves the side of the lead swiftly across the folder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The numbers pop out against the shaded background...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: jots the numbers down on a nearby pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blake tries formatting the numbers into a Social Security number: "608-92-44325" too many numbers.  She scratches i out... She tries again... puts parenthesis around the first thre numbers and a dash after the sixth number:  "(608) 924- 4325"  -- BINGO.  A telephone number...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: picks up the telephone, dials the number...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hillcrest Academy, may I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: from the "Haddonfield Leader" pinned to a large BULLETIN BOARD, tales of the Michael Meyers' slayings splattered across the headlines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TELEPHONE RINGS in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS ACROSS the board, finds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of Meyers' slain victims... bloody, graphic images assaul the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal we are in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter sits beneath a desk... searches for the phone, fin it buried beneath a sea of reports --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Carter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Blake.  How do you feel about Wisconsin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON Carter's puzzled expression...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: parked across the street, filled to capacity with student

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON John watching from outside the school bus as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: strings yellow crime scene tape across the front of the drugstore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stands next to John, arm around his waist... watching curiously...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: leans against the side of the bus next to Shane...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, they're staring right at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to John) You think your mom knows we snuck out last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I didn't tell her where I went.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that all you guys can think about?  Amy never came back last night.  Maybe she's in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better her than me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're unbelievable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda's right.  I have Yale to think about.  Amy's going to the Barbizon School of Beauty -- if they let her retake her boards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON BRUCE CLARK, a young deputy ducks under the yellow tap approaches...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stands in front of a squad car, craning her neck to get a look at the proceedings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce... what's going on?  The kids are here to pick out their costumes for the festival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better take 'em to Virgil's downtown.  We got a dead body in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri's heart skips a beat, she tries to digest the news..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dead body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Amy Kramer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My god...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty messy.  Parents have already been notified.  Our office has been trying to get a hold of you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri fears the worse, tries to hold herself together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know who did this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Eddie Catero didn't show up for work this morning... parents say he never came home last night. Car's still missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wishful) Think Eddie had something to do with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't look good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deputy Clark turns in the direction of the bus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You best keep those students locked behind those gates of yours... got ourselves a cold-blooded killer on the loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night.  Wind assaults the trees.  Lights illuminate a doz dorm windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A compact CAR pulls up behind the gates, high beams illuminating the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is an entrance on either side of the guard house... inside sits Hattie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cups her hands over her eyes, protecting them from th glare of the auto's headlights.  She checks --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: embedded in the console in front of her... black and whit image of the car idling outside the gates illuminates the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON Hattie, unable to make out the identity of the driver. She steps out of the guard house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the gate, she sees a figure slumped behind the wheel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling off) Who's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Please identify yourself, young man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still nothing.  Hattie doesn't know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the gate with her gate key and walks through... approaches the car.  The trees rustle nearby.  She takes look, spooking herself.  It is, after all, Halloween. She crosses to the driver's side window... looks inside t find the body of --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the costume shop victim, slouched behind the wheel... fac bloodied mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Lord...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hattie stumbles backward... she's doesn't see THE SHAPE p through the open gates behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She crosses back to the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hattie quickly presses a BUTTON on the console in front o her, automatically closing the wrought iron gates outside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stands at the entrance to the left of guard house.  Hatti back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up the phone... no dial tone.  She jiggles the receiver... comes up short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLINK.  A noise from outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hattie spins around, faces the left entrance... no one in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.  Hattie crosses to the left entrance, shuts th door... throws the bolt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: appears behind Hattie... now standing at the entrance to right of the guard house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLINK.  Another noise, source unknown...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hattie spins around, faces the right entrance... the Shap has vanished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hattie crosses to the right entrance, shuts the door... l it.  Now secured safely inside the guard house, Hattie crosses to a CB Radio... She turns it on... dials the emergency channel... is distracted by --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: outside the gates... its headlights suddenly extinguish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON Hattie, squints through through window in the car's direction...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: emerges from the shadows behind her... wraps the CB cord around her neck... Hattie struggles to free herself... he face pressed up against the glass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shape brandishes a knife... stabs her repeatedly in t back... ends the struggle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally, the custodian, climbs the four flights of stairs t the massive bell partially enclosed at its top... he tugs the rope dangling from the bell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its sound resonating across the campus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The windows, once lit, are now extinguished, leaving the dorms shrouded in total darkness... lights out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of the ringing bell echoes softly through the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly lies in her bed, unable to sleep, eyes to the ceiling... her pajama clad body partially covered by a sh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: lying beside Molly's bed, also asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly hears the RUSTLING of bushes outside her window... turns in its direction to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: moving forcefully, their branches scratching wildly again glass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sits up in bed, her eyes glued to the window... she slowl gets out of bed, moves toward it... leans against the windowpane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of the campus, bathed in moonlight... wind howls through trees... leaves scurry across the grounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand raps on her window.  Molly jumps out of her skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: standing outside her window, motions her to open it.  She does, sticks her head out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) What are you doing here?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) I came to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see that. (a beat) Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?  You'll get caught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you come out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'll get caught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (louder) Well, I'm not going until I talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.  I'll come out.  Just be quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly and John meander through the wooded acreage along t perimeter of the campus, hand-in-hand... the school build completely obfuscated by the surrounding foliage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really think Eddie killed her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw that Michael Meyers display.  You've got to be pretty twisted to come up with something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess.  It's just hard to believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: appears behind them in the distance, standing beside a tree... watching... waiting.  It seems as though with eac cut the SHAPE moves closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look kind of cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, take my jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John takes off his letterman jacket, drapes it over her shoulders...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHAPE disappears from view, into the thicket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John gazes into Molly's eyes, her moves in closer... they engage in a passionate kiss... John's hands begin to find there way up her blouse when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: grabs them by the back of their necks, pulls them to thei feet!  Shit!  Molly SCREAMS... the CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with a firm grip on them both, a disapproving look painte across her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right... fun's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri moves across the campus, back to the school... Molly John in tow.  They pass the group of faculty houses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to John) Go take a cold shower... I'll deal with you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John heads for his house, waves good-bye to Molly... she waves back sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri and Molly continue toward the dorms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Molly, of all the people... if I can't trust my resident assistant, then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  I'm really, really sorry, Miss Tate.  Please let me keep the job... it's the only way I can afford to stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, tell you what... you can still be the school R.A., but no dance tomorrow night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved) Okay... thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly gives Keri a hug...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something tells me I won't get the same reaction when I tell John...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two are completely unaware of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: watching from the thicket, the moonlight reflected off hi pale white mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STUDENTS scurry from their dorms to the adjacent school building, racing to make it to their a.m. classes on time

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER the legend:  "October 31st.  Halloween."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of students take laps in the indoor swimming pool beneath the retracted gymnasium floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gym is decorated for the Halloween festival that nigh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their coach, MRS. ROCKWELL, supervises from poolside, whi dangling around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON Molly, Linda, and SARAH LOCKE, the resident gossip wit beauty pageant good looks, as they complete their final l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They congregate in the shallow end, their goggles perched their heads...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like everyone's staring at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: News travels fast.  It's all over school about you and John getting busted in the woods by Miss Tate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't suppose you had anything to do with that, motor mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, freak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Rockwell blows her WHISTLE... the girls in the pool for her instruction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, I know you girls have the big Halloween dance tonight, so I'm letting you go ten minutes early today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under her breath) How generous of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly, Linda, and Sarah start to climb out of the pool...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah, since you took it upon yourself to arrive ten minutes late today, you can stay the extra ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Mrs. Rockwell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use the time to practice your drive.  You looked real sloppy out there today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooh, busted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big time.  And news travels fast. Wouldn't be surprised if the whole school knows about this one by tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah flips them the finger...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smile at the birdie, ladies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly and Linda head toward the locker room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah Locke.  What a major bitch. You know she waxes her stomach?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly and Linda exit the gymnasium...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON Sarah as she climbs out of the pool... walks to the di board on the other end of the deserted gym... places the goggles over her eyes... She dives into the water... swims underwater toward the shallow end... she heads toward the surface...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHAPE is standing poolside... his image warped by the rolling water, bobbing and swaying with the current.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah breaks through the surface of the water, catches he breath... throws off her goggles, scans the gym...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty.  Not a soul in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah shrugs it off, climbs back out of the pool... heads the diving board...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She dives into the water... as she emerges in the shallow the lights in the gym extinguish... leaving her in darkne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Hey!  There's someone in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.  Sarah moves toward the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Hell-o!  I'm in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs the railing, starts to pull herself out of the pool, when suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pushes her back into the pool... holds her head under the water... her arms flail wildly as she struggles for breat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shape flashes a knife... slices into flesh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah's body goes limp... the SHAPE releases her... her lifeless body floats face down in the bloody water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHAPE has disappeared from view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gym floor begins to close over the pool, covering the floating corpse inside of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri moves across campus, notices --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: open to the single lane road exiting the school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri eyes the GUARDHOUSE that sits at the entrance, indig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri enters, the guard house is empty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling off) Hattie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's nowhere in sight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Now where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri pushes a BUTTON on the console in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: slowly begin to close...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: exits the guard house, closes the door behind her... head back to the school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sits on the console, filled with a deep red liquid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drop of blood falls from

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood soaks the drop-ceiling... Hattie's corpse hidden fr view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GATES SHUT tight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri walks into her office, shuts the door behind her... turns to find

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: seated in front of her desk... Blake stands beside him, looking out the office window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri jumps at the sight of the uninvited guests --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled) Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter stands, takes one look at her and knows he's hit t jackpot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be damned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I know you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're sorry to startle you, Miss Tate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door was open, so we let ourselves in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see that.  Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter flashes a smile, then his badge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Carter from the Haddonfield P.D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toni Blake from Langley P.D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri knows exactly why they're here, her dual lives are crossing paths... they've found little sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind if we sit down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd prefer you didn't.  I'm very busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, then how 'bout we ask you a few questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I think it would be best if you both left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might want to stop and think about the safety of your students, Miss Tate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never stop thinking about it, Detective. (pointing out the window) The only way in or out of this school is through that gate, and it is secured at all times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny, we just drove right in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I can assure you, it won't happen again.  Thanks for your concern.  Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter starts out... turns back toward Keri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has anyone ever told you, you bear a striking resemblance to Laurie Strode?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri glares at him for a beat... the walls around her are collapsing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never heard of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blake removes a business card from her pocket, a phone nu scribbled across its face.  She places it on the desk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ferndale P.D. is setting up a roadblock couple miles down the road.  They think they're looking for a jealous boyfriend gone mad... I think differently.  We can protect you..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keri doesn't flinch, motions toward the door.  Carter and Blake start out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter stops, turns back toward her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not without some help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter and Blake exit, shut the door behind them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter and Blake in a rental car to the side of the road outside the gates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
